Item 1. Business.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART I - Item 1. Business section in bullet points:

• Rivian is an American automotive manufacturer that develops and builds category-defining electric vehicles (EVs) as well as software and services.
• The Company creates innovative and technologically advanced products with the goal of accelerating the global transition to zero-emission transportation and energy.
• Rivian vehicles are built in the United States and sold directly to consumer and commercial customers.
• The company's competitive advantage stems from its vertically integrated technologies, including zonal network architecture and associated in-vehicle electronic control units.
• Rivian has earned some of the industry's most coveted owner experience awards for its product performance benefits.
• The company formed a Joint Venture with VW Group Technology, LLC to develop industry-leading software-enabled features and capabilities.
• Rivian offers an integrated set of software and services that span across the entire purchase and ownership process, including remarketing, vehicle repair and maintenance, charging, software subscriptions, financing, insurance, and more.
• The company analyzes its results through two reportable segments: Automotive and Software and Services.

Item 1A. Risk Factors.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART I - Item 1A. Risk Factors section of RIVN's Form 10-K:

• Net losses: $6.8 billion, $5.4 billion, and $4.7 billion for the years ended December 31, 2022, 2023, and 2024, respectively.
• Expectation of continued significant expenses and potential continuing losses for the foreseeable future.
• No assurance that RIVN will ever achieve or maintain profitability in the future.
• Dependence on successful development, commercial production, and adoption of vehicles, software, and services to become profitable.
• Potential impact of government incentives, tax credits, and regulatory credits becoming unavailable or changing in the future.
• Risk of cost increases due to changes in tariffs and potential decrease in demand for exported vehicles.
• Potential failure to adequately increase revenues or contain costs could prevent RIVN from achieving or maintaining profitability.

Item 1C. Cybersecurity.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - Item 1C. Cybersecurity section in bullet points:

• The Rivian cybersecurity risk management program is led by the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) and includes processes for assessing, identifying, and managing material risks from cybersecurity threats.

• The CISO leads a team of cybersecurity professionals with decades of experience in the practice of cybersecurity within relevant industries.

• The company's cybersecurity risk management program aligns with industry standard frameworks such as the National Institute of Standards and Technology Cybersecurity Framework (NIST CSF).

• The program includes key elements such as cybersecurity risk assessments, security teams, training and awareness programs, cybersecurity monitoring, threat intelligence, and incident response plans.

• The audit committee of the board of directors is responsible for oversight of cybersecurity risks and receives periodic updates on the activities of the cybersecurity risk program.

• To date, Rivian has experienced no material cybersecurity incidents that have affected the company or its financial position.

Item 2. Properties.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - Item 2. Properties section in bullet points:

• Rivian is based in Southern California.
• The Normal Factory, a manufacturing facility, has an approximate area of 4.7 million square feet and can produce up to 150,000 vehicles annually.
• A long-term rental agreement was entered into for approximately 1,700 acres of land near Social Circle, Georgia (Stanton Springs North Facility) in November 2023.
• Construction of the Stanton Springs North Facility is planned to begin in 2026.

Item 3. Legal Proceedings.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - Item 3. Legal Proceedings section as bullet points:

• On July 17, 2020, Tesla, Inc. filed a suit against Rivian Automotive, Inc., Rivian Automotive, LLC, and several former Tesla/current Rivian group employees in California Superior Court, Santa Clara County.

• The claims in the operative pleading, the Fourth Amended Complaint (4AC) filed on September 28, 2021, were for trade secret misappropriation against Rivian and various individual defendants, and breach of contract against the individual defendants.

• On March 7, 2022, three alleged stockholders filed lawsuits against Rivian Automotive, Inc., certain officers and directors, and Rivian's IPO underwriters on behalf of a putative class of purchasers of Rivian common stock in the IPO.

• The lead plaintiff filed an amended consolidated complaint alleging violations of Sections 11, 12(a)(2), and 15 of the Securities Act of 1933 and Sections 10(b) and 20(a) of the Exchange Act on July 22, 2022.

• A similar lawsuit styled Smith, et al. v. Rivian Automotive, Inc., et al., was filed by two alleged stockholders in California Superior Court, Orange County on February 28, 2023.

• On January 27, 2023, six individuals filed a Complaint in Morgan County (Georgia) Superior Court against Morgan County, Georgia, seeking declaratory and injunctive relief related to the property where Rivian New Horizon's planned manufacturing plant is to be located.

• The suit was dismissed with prejudice on December 13, 2024.

Item 5. Market for Registrant's Common E.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - Item 5. Market for Registrant's Common Equity, Related Stockholder Matters and Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities section:

• Rivian Automotive, Inc.'s Class A common stock has been traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol "RIVN" since November 10, 2021.
• As of February 14, 2025, there were approximately 108 shareholders of record of our Class A common stock and one shareholder of record of our Class B common stock.
• The net proceeds to us from our IPO on November 15, 2021, were $13.5 billion after deducting the underwriting discount and commissions of approximately $185 million.
• All shares sold in the IPO were registered pursuant to a registration statement on Form S-1 (File No. 333-259992), as amended, which was declared effective by the SEC on November 9, 2021.
• The net proceeds from our IPO have been invested in investment grade instruments.
• There has been no material change in the use of proceeds from our IPO as described in our final prospectus.
• Rivian Automotive, Inc. has never declared or paid any cash dividends on its capital stock and currently intends to retain all available funds for business expansion.
• The company's operations are generally conducted through its subsidiaries, making it dependent on earnings and distributions from these subsidiaries to pay dividends to shareholders.

Item 7. Management’s Discussion and Anal.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART II - Item 7. Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations section in bullet points:

• The company produced 49,476 vehicles and delivered 51,579 vehicles during the year ended December 31, 2024.
• The company's reportable segments are now Automotive and Software and Services, following a change in segment composition as of December 31, 2024.

Item 7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Di.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - Item 7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures about Market Risk section of RIVN's Form 10-K:

• Our cash, cash equivalents, and short-term investments primarily consist of cash on hand and investments in money market instruments, United States Treasury securities, commercial paper, corporate bonds, and term deposits with maturities up to 12 months.

• A hypothetical 100 basis point increase or decrease in interest rates would not have a material effect on the fair market value of our portfolio due to its short-term nature.

• Our floating rate debt bears interest at floating rates, which means that a rising interest rate environment would increase the amount of interest paid on these borrowings by an amount that is not material.

• The fair value of our Green Convertible Notes will generally increase as interest rates fall and decrease as interest rates rise.

• The fair value of our Green Convertible Notes is also subject to market price risk due to their conversion features, which can be affected when the market price of our Class A common stock fluctuates.

Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplem.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART II - Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data section in bullet points:

• As of December 31, 2024, Rivian Automotive, Inc.'s consolidated balance sheets present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of the Company.
• The Company's internal control over financial reporting was effective as of December 31, 2024, and an unqualified opinion was expressed on this effectiveness by the audit firm on February 24, 2025.
• The warranty reserve as of December 31, 2024 was $473 million.
• The consolidated financial statements were audited in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) for the three-year period ended December 31, 2024.
• The audit firm conducted its audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB).

Item 9A. Controls and Procedures.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - Item 9A. Controls and Procedures section in bullet points:

• As of December 31, 2024, RIVN's CEO and CFO concluded that the Company's disclosure controls and procedures were effective at the reasonable assurance level.
• The Company's internal control over financial reporting is designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and preparation of consolidated financial statements in accordance with GAAP.
• KPMG LLP, the Company's independent registered public accounting firm, issued an unqualified opinion on the effectiveness of RIVN's internal control over financial reporting.
• There were no changes in RIVN's internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended December 31, 2024 that materially affected or are reasonably likely to affect it.

Item 9B. Other Information.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART II - Item 9B. Other Information section:

• The company amended and restated its investors' rights agreement (A&R IRA) on November 13, 2024.
• The termination of shareholders' rights under the A&R IRA was extended until November 13, 2031.
• No director or officer adopted a "Rule 10b5-1 trading arrangement" or "non-Rule 10b5-1 trading arrangement" during the three months ended December 31, 2024.
